business.headline: Sensex, Nifty end flat as markets await CPI data; banking stocks see declineThe S&P BSE Sensex added 16.09 points to close at 81,526.14, while the NSE Nift50 gained 31.75 points to end at 24,641.80.
What challenges await Sanjay Malhotra as he takes charge as RBI Governor?Sanjay Malhotra takes over at a challenging time, with India's economic growth slowing to 5.4% in the July-September quarter.

Mobikwik vs Vishal Mega Mart IPO: Which public issue should you subscribe to? The IPO of Vishal Mega Mart aims to raise Rs 8,000 crore via an offer for sale of 102.56 crore shares, while that of Mobikwik is looking to raise Rs 572 crore through an entirely fresh issue of 2.05 crore shares.

Sebi proposes using DigiLocker for reducing unclaimed assets: 3 things to knowSebi has proposed using DigiLocker to simplify asset management, reduce unclaimed assets, and enable faster paperless services.

Mobikwik IPO fully subscribed on Day 1. What's behind the strong demand?Mobikwik's IPO was subscribed over 3.5 times as of 1 pm. According to data, Mobikwik's IPO received bids for 3,96,80,623 shares against the 1,18,71,696 shares on offer.

LIC Bima Sakhi Yojana explained: Check eligibility, and stipendThe LIC Bima Sakhi Yojana empowers women aged 18-70 with training, stipends, and LIC agent roles, promoting financial inclusion and independence.

Explained: Why PNC Infratech share price jumped 12% todayAt around 12:08 pm, shares of PNC Infratech were trading 9.81% higher at Rs 341.25. The strong performance came after the civil construction firm announced the early completion of a key highway project, boosting investor sentiment.

Why Adani Ports decided to opt out of $553 million US loan for Sri Lanka projectAdani Ports and Special Economic Zone Ltd (APSEZ) said it would instead use its own resources to fund the project, citing alignment with its capital management plans.
Elon Musk's Tesla resumes hunt for New Delhi showroom with DLF: ReportTesla has resumed showroom space searches in New Delhi, exploring options with DLF, as it reconsiders entering India.

RVNL, Titagarh, Jupiter Wagons: Why railway stocks are rallying todayRailway stocks: Share price of stocks from the railway sector such as IRCTC, RVNL, Titagarh, IRFC, Jupiter Wagons, witnessed a rise in early trade on Wedesday after major announcements from the government

Vedanta share price surges over 4%. Check key factors behind today's rallyVedanta share price today: The rally can be attributed to several factors, including operational enhancements, bullish market sentiment, and positive brokerage ratings.

Sai Life Sciences IPO opens: Should you apply? Check all details, latest GMPSai Life Sciences IPO: The public offering includes a fresh share issue worth Rs 950 crore, while promoters and existing shareholders will offload 3.81 crore shares amounting to Rs 2,092.62 crore.
Mobikwik IPO open for bidding: Subscribe or skip? Check latest GMPMobikwik IPO for bidding: The Mobikwik IPO aims to raise Rs 572 crore and will close for subscription on December 13, 2024.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as inflation data keeps market on edgeThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 1.44 points to 81,511.49, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 13.85 points to 24,623.90.

Vishal Mega Mart IPO: Should you subscribe? Check latest GMPVishal Mega Mart IPO: The public offering is entirely an offer for sale of 102.56 crore shares, which means the company will receive no capital from the listing and all proceeds will go to the selling shareholders.

Adani Ports shares to be in spotlight today. Here's why Adani group stocks: Shares of Adani Ports are expected to be in focus today after the firm shared a crucial announcement to the stock exchanges for one of its projects in Sri Lanka.

PAN 2.0: A step-by-step guide to applying for a reprint with QR codeIndian PAN cardholders can now reprint their PAN card with a QR code for just Rs 50 through Protean or UTIITSL portals, the process of which is simple and user-friendly.

Stocks to watch today: Adani Ports, Bajaj Auto, NTPC Green EnergySeveral stocks are likely to be in focus due to recent news and developments, such as Adani Ports, Adani Green Energy, Bajaj Auto, Star Health, Awfis Space, NTPC Green, among others.

Will use own resources: Adani Ports opts out of US funding for Colombo Port projectAdani Ports said the Colombo Port project was on track for commissioning by early next year and that it will fund the project through "internal accruals", aligning with its capital management strategy.

Haldiram's attracts bids from Alpha Wave, 2 others for 15-20% stake: ReportThe bids, which could mark one of India's largest private-equity deals, peg the company's valuation at Rs 75,000-80,000 crore ($8.8-9.4 billion).

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Jagdeep Dhankhar a government spokesperson: Mallikarjun Kharge on no-trust moveMallikarjun Kharge alleged that Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar's "fidelity" was towards the ruling BJP instead of the Constitution and constitutional tradition.

Atul Subhash's wife will answer: In-law, named in case, rejects harassment chargeAtul Subhash's uncle-in-law dismissed the accusations of harassment as "baseless" and reiterated his family's innocence. "No one from our family is guilty," he said.

In battle of two billionaires, Indian taxpayer bleeding Rs 2.5 lakh per minuteParliament's winter session has almost been a washout because of disruptions. The BJP and the Congress are locked in a battle over billionaires Gautam Adani and George Soros. The lack of House business is resulting in waste of taxpayer money and ignoring of issues of public priority.

PM's adviser clarifies funding from George Soros charge: No money came directlyShamika Ravi has shot back at Congress leader Pawan Khera after he claimed that she had received funds from an organisation funded by American investor George Soros.

PM meets Raj Kapoor's family, honours his life and legacy ahead of birth centenaryPrime Minister Narendra Modi met the Kapoor family to honour legendary filmmaker Raj Kapoor's legacy ahead of his birth centenary on December 14. The Kapoor family invited the PM to the Raj Kapoor Film Festival, celebrating his 100-year legacy.

Rahul Gandhi says House must run; 'Only when Congress decides,' Trinamool scoffsRahul Gandhi asserted that the Opposition's main aim was to allow Parliament to function and insisted that the Constitution debate should take place on December 13.

A dead man must speak because...: Bengaluru techie's letter to PresidentBengaluru techie suicide: In his letter to the President, which emerged on Wednesday, Atul Subhash criticised the justice system and highlighted a rising trend of false cases being filed against men by their estranged wives.

Removing Rajya Sabha Chairman Dhankhar won't be a cakewalk. Here's whyThe Opposition has submitted a notice for a no-confidence motion against Rajya Sabha Chairman Jagdeep Dhankhar. While no Vice-President has ever been removed from office, the Constitution outlines a rigorous process for the removal. Does the NDA have enough MPs to beat the Opposition move?
Snowfall turns Kashmir into winter wonderland: Breathtaking photosA light dusting of snow adds a touch of winter charm to the Valley's scenic beauty.

Mukherjee Nagar: Is Delhi's UPSC capital dying? | India Today Culture ProjectOnce the beating heart of UPSC dreams, Mukherjee Nagar was more than a locality — it was a way of life for aspirants chasing India's toughest exam.

Corbett cameras used to spy on women? Probe on, but eyes wide shutDigital devices, including camera traps, were being used by male villagers and forest guards to monitor women who go into the forest for foraging. This was first reported by India Today Digital on November 25. A probe is on but officials are promising nothing more even after two weeks.
2024 is the hottest year on record: What made it so dangerous?November 2024 alone was noted as the second-hottest November on record, with temperatures around 1.62°C above pre-industrial levels.

Kareena Kapoor gets PM Modi's autograph for her sons as she meets him with familyThe Kapoor family met PM Modi to invite him to the RK Film Festival on December 14, commemorating Raj Kapoor's 100th birth anniversary. Kareena even got an autograph for her sons.

Google reveals 10 most searched recipes of 2024. This Indian side dish stood outGoogle's 'Year in Search 2024' reveals the top recipes of the year, with Mango Pickle and Porn Star Martini leading the way in India, while global trends feature Olympic Muffins and Tini's Mac and Cheese.

Will CBSE'S two-level exam model for Science, Social Science limit students?Much like its Basic Math and Standard Math model for Classes 9 and 10, CBSE is set to introduce a two-level learning and exam model for Science and Social Science as well to cater to diverse learning needs. This aims to reduce academic stress and boost flexibility for future career goals. But what challenges does this CBSE model come with?

Bengaluru techie suicide: A reality check of family court systemAtul Subhash Suicide Case: The over 20-page suicide note by Bengaluru techie Atul Subhash raised serious allegations against his wife, his family and even the family court system for pushing him towards the decision to end his life.

Massive tree falls on tourists in Bali's Monkey Forest. Video horrifies InternetTwo tourists died after a massive tree collapsed on them in Bali's Monkey Forest. A chilling video of the incident has gone viral on social media.

INS Tushil to bolster India's naval power amid expanding defence diplomacyThe commissioning of the multi-role stealth missile frigate reflects India's focus on maritime security while balancing partnerships with both Russia and the West

BJP accuses Siddaramaiah of neglecting Karnataka's issues to aid Wayanad victimsKarnataka BJP slammed Chief Minister Siddaramaiah for prioritising building houses in Wayanad over addressing the state's issues. Leaders criticised the Congress government for ignoring farmer suicides, unpaid workers, and housing needs while accusing it of appeasing Rahul Gandhi.

Rahul Gandhi gives rose, Tricolour to Rajnath Singh during Parliament protestIn a unique gesture of protest, Congress MP and Leader of Opposition in the Lok Sabha, Rahul Gandhi, handed a rose and a Tricolour to Defence Minister Rajnath Singh at the Parliament premises.

Aishwarya Rai, Abhishek Bachchan's old video dancing to Desi Girl goes viralAishwarya Rai and Abhishek Bachchan's old video dancing to the song, Desi Girl, has gone viral. The two were also joined by their daughter Aaradhya.

sports.headline: Mithali Raj parts ways with Gujarat Giants before WPL auction: Sources   Gujarat Giants and Mithali Raj have parted ways after the team failed to qualify beyond the league stages in both editions of the Women's Premier League. The Giants have the highest purse amongst all five teams in the tournament.

Chess, chocolate cake and sambar rice: Viswanathan Anand reveals birthday plansChess great Viswanathan Anand thanked his fans for their birthday wishes and revealed his plans for the special day. Anand was gearing up to watch Game 13 of the Chess World Championship on Wednesday.

Haris Rauf, Danni Wyatt-Hodge named ICC Players of the Month for NovemberPakistan fast bowler Haris Rauf and England women's batter Danni Wyatt-Hodge were adjudged ICC Player of the Month for November.

Malaysian doubles specialist coach Tan Kim Her returns to India for second stintThe Badminton Association of India (BAI) has appointed Malaysian doubles specialist Tan Kim Her to work with the national team for the second time.

Australia name 15-year-old WBBL sensation in U19 T20 World Cup squad Australia picked 15-year-old Caoimhe Bray for the upcoming edition of the Women's U19 T20 World Cup to be staged next year in Malaysia. The youngster recently played for Sydney Sixers in the WBBL.

Bumrah was taken off the attack after bowling just 4 overs on Day 2 morning session of the 2nd Test match.

Rohit Sharma should sacrifice his position for India's future: PujaraIND vs AUS, 3rd Test: Rohit Sharma should continue to bat in the middle-order feels Cheteshwar Pujara. Pujara wants KL Rahul and Yashasvi Jaiswal to continue in the top order keeping India's future in mind.

Kylian Mbappe injured? Ancelotti hopes no serious issue with Real Madrid starReal Madrid boss Carlo Ancelotti is hoping that Kylian Mbappe's injury he sustained in the UEFA Champions League clash against Atalanta on Tuesday, December 10. Mbappe was in fine form during the match before the injury forced him off the field.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
